trial_identification.studytitle: Outcome evaluation of the Nepean and Blue Mountains Diabetes Integration Program and the Sessions for Health and Physical Exercise Program
trial_identification.scientifictitle: In patients with type 2 diabetes what is the impact of exercise and diet group therapy on participants' knowledge and self-reported diet and exercise activity, their self-reported health status, and their weight, body mass index (BMI) and waist circumference? (Uncontrolled before-and-after design)

interventions.interventions: Participants will be invited to attend eight one-hour group therapy sessions over a total of eight weeks. The sessions will address exercise and diet in type 2 diabetes, and will be run by an exercise physiologist with assistance from a dietician.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Proportion of participants attaining diet and exercise targets for people living with type 2 diabetes (self-report)
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Start, end and three months following completion of group therapy program. There is an additional site for the project, and participants from this site will not be asked to complete a three-month questionaire.

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This is a before and after evaluation of the impact of group exercise and diet therapy for people with type 2 diabetes. Participants will be assessed at the start of eight one-hour sessions, after the final session, and again three months later. At each time point they will report their exercise and diet activity, and their health status. Their weight, waist circumference and knowledge will also be assessed
